com.almasb.fxgl.input

Interface Input

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FXGLListener, UpdateEventListener, UserProfileSavable

    public interface Input
extends UserProfileSavable, UpdateEventListener, FXGLListener
    Allows input data queries as well as action bindings.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (almaslvl@gmail.com)

        default void onExit()
        Description copied from interface: FXGLListener
        Fired before the system is about to shut down. Do NOT make any asynchronous calls as they may not complete.
        Specified by:
        onExit in interface FXGLListener

                  Viewport viewport,
                  double scaleRatio)
        Called on mouse event.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse event
        viewport - current viewport where the even occurred
        scaleRatio - scale ratio of the display where the event occurred

      • setRegisterInput

        void setRegisterInput(boolean register)
        Setting to false will disable capturing of input events. Not captured events will not be processed.
        Parameters:
        register - true to enable, false to disable
        Default Value:
        true

      • isRegisterInput

        boolean isRegisterInput()
        Returns:
        are input events being registered

      • setProcessInput

        void setProcessInput(boolean process)
        Setting to false will disable processing of input events. The events may still be captured but they will not be processed.
        Parameters:
        process - true to enable, false to disable
        Default Value:
        true

      • isProcessInput

        boolean isProcessInput()
        Returns:
        are input events being processed

      • isHeld

        boolean isHeld(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
        Parameters:
        key - the key to check
        Returns:
        true iff key is currently (physically) held; mocking does not trigger this

      • isHeld

        boolean isHeld(javafx.scene.input.MouseButton button)
        Parameters:
        button - the button to check
        Returns:
        true iff button is currently (physically) held; mocking does not trigger this

        Map<UserAction,Trigger> getBindings()
        Returns:
        registered action bindings

      • addAction

        default void addAction(UserAction action,
                       javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
        Bind given action to a keyboard key.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to bind
        key - the key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if action with same name exists or key is in use

      • addAction

        void addAction(UserAction action,
               javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key,
               InputModifier modifier)
        Bind given action to a keyboard key with special modifier key.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to bind
        key - the key
        modifier - the key modifier
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if action with same name exists or key is in use

      • rebind

        default boolean rebind(UserAction action,
                       javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
        Rebinds an existing action to given key.
        Parameters:
        action - the user action
        key - the key to rebind to
        Returns:
        true if rebound, false if action not found or there is another action bound to key

      • rebind

               javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key,
               InputModifier modifier)
        Rebinds an existing action to given key.
        Parameters:
        action - the user action
        key - the key to rebind to
        modifier - the key modifier
        Returns:
        true if rebound, false if action not found or there is another action bound to key

        button - the mouse button
        modifier - the buttin modifier
        Returns:
        true if rebound, false if action not found or there is another action bound to mouse button

      • addInputMapping

        void addInputMapping(InputMapping mapping)
        Add input mapping. The actual implementation needs to be specified by OnUserAction annotation.
        Parameters:
        mapping - the mapping

      • scanForUserActions

        void scanForUserActions(Object instance)
        Given an object, scans its methods for OnUserAction annotation and creates UserActions from its data.
        Parameters:
        instance - the class instance to scan

      • clearAll

        void clearAll()
        Clears all active actions. Releases all key presses and mouse clicks for a single frame.

      • mockKeyPress

        default void mockKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
        Mocks key press event. The behavior is equivalent to user pressing and holding the key. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to mock

      • mockKeyPress

        void mockKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key,
                  InputModifier modifier)
        Mocks key press event. The behavior is equivalent to user pressing and holding the key with the modifier. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to mock
        modifier - key modifier

      • mockKeyRelease

        default void mockKeyRelease(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
        Mocks key release event. The behavior is equivalent to user releasing the key. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to mock

      • mockKeyRelease

        void mockKeyRelease(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key,
                    InputModifier modifier)
        Mocks key release event. The behavior is equivalent to user releasing the key and the modifier. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to mock
        modifier - the modifier

      • mockButtonPress

        default void mockButtonPress(javafx.scene.input.MouseButton button,
                             double gameX,
                             double gameY)
        Mocks button press event. The behavior is equivalent to user pressing and holding the button at x, y. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to mock
        gameX - x in game world
        gameY - y in game world

      • mockButtonPress

        void mockButtonPress(javafx.scene.input.MouseButton button,
                     double gameX,
                     double gameY,
                     InputModifier modifier)
        Mocks button press event. The behavior is equivalent to user pressing and holding the button and the modifier at x, y. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to mock
        modifier - the modifier
        gameX - x in game world
        gameY - y in game world

      • mockButtonRelease

        default void mockButtonRelease(javafx.scene.input.MouseButton button)
        Mocks button release event. The behavior is equivalent to user releasing the button. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to mock

      • mockButtonRelease

        void mockButtonRelease(javafx.scene.input.MouseButton button,
                       InputModifier modifier)
        Mocks button release event. The behavior is equivalent to user releasing the button. Note: the event will be processed directly even if register input is false. The event will NOT be processed if process input is false.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to mock
        modifier - the modifier

        default javafx.geometry.Point2D getVectorToMouse(javafx.geometry.Point2D gamePosition)
        Parameters:
        gamePosition - point in game world
        Returns:
        vector from given point to mouse cursor point

      • getVectorFromMouse

        default javafx.geometry.Point2D getVectorFromMouse(javafx.geometry.Point2D gamePosition)
        Parameters:
        gamePosition - point in game world
        Returns:
        vector from mouse cursor point to given point
